content.description:
A very nice mix of face and thin crack moves, Winter's Respite is a good way to push your limits a little if you're getting confident as a 5.8 leader. 

  Starting with somewhat slabby and sparsely-protected face climbing, move up to steeper ground and trend right and up to a finger crack.  Follow the crack to finish at the big ledge.
content.protection: Small to medium gear (nuts, cams, tricams).  Bolted anchor.
content.location: The first route on the Winter Wall; just left of an obvious large corner.

content.description: One of the several great climbs that make up a concentrated area of climbs on the Winter Wall.  Look for a shallow vertical crack/shallow right facing dihedral that leads up and over a series of roofs to a rest stance.  Follow crack system up to a large pine
content.protection: Trad rack with small gear.  There is a nice fixed pin for the crux moves through the roof.  Also, take some long slings.
content.location: Follow directions for The Winter Wall.  Tainted Love is left of an often mossy wet spot past Winter's Respite.

content.description: Start same as Loose Block, clip the fixed pin, then climb left of the corner...stay left of the dead pine tree...and run it to the top with a single yellow TCU placement to the right near the edge of the dihedral.
content.protection: I found five placements...one after digging out a dirty horizontal...nothing larger than a .75 camalot.

content.description: According to the Dixie Craggers Atlas, by Chris Watford, this climb has "jams so good you'll feel like Aaron Ralston!"  The Arch follows a left to right arching crack.  With a short traverse at the top to the anchors...watch for loose stuff.
content.protection: Trad rack.  Long runners.  Shares anchors with Hairdressers on Fire.  This route can be led to set up H on Fire.
content.location: Winter wall.  Just to the right of a free-standing pillar.

climbs.name: Pumpkin Spice
climbs.fa: Jeff Mekolites and Johanna Wise, October 2008

content.description:
Slab climbing over two short roofs with very thin gear. 

  Slab your way up to the lower roof placing all the gear you can.  (I placed a grey alien about halfway up to the roof and a small nut slotted behind a odd flake under the roof.)  Pull the roof using a some rounded edges.  After pulling up, there is a slot for another small nut.  Continue up to a good ledge with bomber gear.  Work up and slightly right past a rail then more good gear.  Thin moves but solid moves lead towards the second roof.  Once at the roof, another gear placement can be found.  Pull the roof and make a quick dash to the anchors. 

  This route can easily be TR'ed after leading W.R., but it's also a very sastifying lead.
content.protection: Black - Red Alien, small nuts, 1.5 Friend.  This route shares rap rings with Winters Respite.
content.location: To the right of Winters Respite.  You will be climbing the arete edge and face to the right of W.R. climbing past two roofs/overlaps.  Starts about 15 feet to the right.

content.description:
A fun route with a thin and tricky start.  Despite the name, loose rock on this climb is not a problem (though wet, seeping rock often is).  Not exactly a routine 5.7. 

  Starting on a slab with sparse protection, move up to a fixed pin about 20' up.  Continue up to the base of a short right-facing dihedral with good protection, then climb this dihedral up to a spacious ledge.  A second short dihedral leads to a finish just below a big ledge at the top.
content.protection: Standard rack, nothing bigger than 2".  Bolted anchors at the lip of the ledge.
content.location: Starts about 20' left of Winter's Respite.  Rap from ring anchors.

content.description: H.I. follows a very thin seam up to a block.  Go up and left or directly over to a rest stance.  Follow delicate crack/face moves to rap rings at the top.
content.protection: Trad rack with small gear for thin section down low.  Long runners to help minimize rope drag.
content.location: Located just left of Tainted Love on the Winter Wall.

climbs.name: Hairdressers on Fire
climbs.fa: John Vermont (TR)  bolted by Chris Watford and Darrell Jordan, 1991

content.description: Fantastic route with thin moves from top to bottom.  The climb starts left of High Infidelity off of grassy ledge.
content.protection: 5 bolts and rap rings.  Some bring a small alien/tcu for some added mental comfort between the ground and the high first bolt.
content.location: Hairdressers on Fire climbs the striking orange face on Winter Wall

content.description: Short route with a series of hard moves at the bottom featuring a short overlap, underclings, high steps and crimpers.
content.location: On the front of the detached pillar at the end of the winter wall.

content.description: The route starts in a crack behind the free standing pillar on the left end of the Winter Wall.  Follow an arching/thinning crack, (that parallels The Arch - but slightly higher) to the same shared anchors.
content.protection: Trad rack (small gear helpful) and a few long runners.  Anchors at the top.
content.location: Look for the detached, free-standing pillar at the left end of the Winter Wall.  Start behind the pillar.

climbs.name: Cinnamon Boys
climbs.fa: Jeff Mekolites, Scott Perkins and Chris Watford, March 2012

content.description: A variation/direct start to Cinnamon Girl.  Boulder the thin slab start to a stance and a bolt.  Continue up a finger crack where boys meets girl, follow the arching crack a short bit.  But instead of going all the way to the Hairdressers anchors climb up the face, (look for another crack and some flakes) to rap rings under a big roof.
content.protection: Mostly small stuff.  Nothing too big.  Rap rings under big roof.
content.location: Located on a slab between Cinnamon Girl and The Arch...look for the lone bolt.

content.description: The Winter Wall is a short section of less than 10 routes before you reach the end of the SCC-owned property (climbing past this point is off-limits).
